content.title: Ashraya Adhar Scheme
content.details: The Ashraya Adhar Scheme provides financial assistance in the form of loans for housing purposes, with specific provisions for repayment and moratorium periods.
benefits: Grace period before loan repayment starts
Option to repay loan before moratorium ends
Extended repayment period for applicants above 50 years
Loan repayment alignment with retirement plans
Possibility to transfer loan to another financial institution
Provision for partial prepayment of the loan
Potential tax benefits on loan repayments
eligibility: Must be a resident of Goa
Employment status may affect repayment terms
exclusions: Providing false information may lead to legal consequences
Specific penalties for defaulting on EMIs
content.application_process: Applications can be submitted online or offline to the Housing Corporation.

faqs.question: What is the purpose of the moratorium period in the loan repayment process?
faqs.answer: The moratorium period serves as a grace period before the repayment of the loan starts, allowing borrowers to adjust financially.

faqs.question: Can I repay the loan before the end of the moratorium period?
faqs.answer: Yes, you can repay the loan immediately after the disbursement of the first installment.

faqs.question: How is the loan repayment period determined for applicants above 50 years of age?
faqs.answer: The repayment period will be extended until you reach 60 years of age.

faqs.question: What happens if I'm employed by a government entity and plan to retire during the loan repayment period?
faqs.answer: Your repayment period will be re-fixed until your retirement age, plus an additional six months.

faqs.question: What is the penalty for defaulting on an EMI repayment?
faqs.answer: An interest rate of 2% will be charged on the overdue installment amount.

faqs.question: Can I transfer my loan to another financial institution for house reconstruction during the repayment period?
faqs.answer: Yes, but you will need to repay the outstanding loan balance in one lump sum.

faqs.question: What happens if I'm unable to repay the loan as per the schedule?
faqs.answer: The Corporation will initiate recovery proceedings as arrears under the Goa Daman and Diu Land Revenue Code.

faqs.question: Who has the authority to sanction loans under the Ashraya Adhar Scheme?
faqs.answer: The Chairman of the Corporation, along with any two Directors, will approve the loan applications.

faqs.question: Is there a provision to modify the scheme if needed?
faqs.answer: Yes, the scheme can be modified to address new challenges or requirements.

faqs.question: What if I provide incorrect or fraudulent information to avail benefits under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Providing false information can result in criminal breach of trust.

faqs.question: Can I prepay a portion of my loan during the repayment period?
faqs.answer: Yes, partial prepayment is generally allowed.

faqs.question: What happens if I miss a few EMIs due to unforeseen circumstances?
faqs.answer: You might incur penalties in the form of the 2% interest on overdue amounts.

faqs.question: Can I change my repayment schedule after the loan is sanctioned?
faqs.answer: The repayment schedule is typically fixed, but you can discuss changes with the Corporation.

faqs.question: Are there any tax benefits associated with this loan repayment?
faqs.answer: Tax benefits might be available based on local regulations.

faqs.question: Can I apply for a loan extension beyond the specified tenure?
faqs.answer: Loan extensions might be considered on a case-by-case basis.

faqs.question: Is there a penalty for repaying the loan earlier than the scheduled tenure?
faqs.answer: Check the loan agreement for any prepayment penalties.
